## Properties

| **Property**                        | **Values**                                   | **Default**
|-----------------------------------  |----------------------------------------------| -----------------------------------------------
| State `Variant`                     | `Default \| Hover \| Focus`                  | `Default`
| Is current page `Boolean`           | `true \| false`                              | `false`
| Has icon `Boolean`                  | `true \| false`                              | `false`
| Icon  `InstanceSwap`                | `Any icon`                                   | `heart`
| Has label `Boolean`                 | `true \| false`                              | `true`
| Label `Text`                        | `string`                                     | `Page 1`

## Overflow

To handle long navigation paths, breadcrumb component truncates middle items with an ellipsis.
Hovering over this ellipsis reveals a dropdown, allowing users to access and navigate through the hidden pages.

| **Property**                        | **Values**                                   | **Default**
|-----------------------------------  |----------------------------------------------| -----------------------------------------------
| Has overflow `Boolean`              | `true \| false`                              | `false`
| Swap content  `InstanceSwap`        | `Any component`                              | `Placeholder`


## When to use

{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M5 13l4 4L19 7" style={{ stroke: "var(--text-positive)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} Breadcrumb navigation allows users to navigate back to previous page levels. <br/><br/>
{<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" style={{ display: 'inline', verticalAlign: 'middle' }}><path d="M6 6L18 18M6 18L18 6" style={{ stroke: "var(--text-negative)" }} strokeWidth="2" /></svg>} When the main navigation already provides sufficient context for navigation. <br/>

## Size

Dimensions of the breadcrumb are tied to the global `scale` tokens. This ensures that the components with similar size settings remain consistent across the interface. `scale` tokens also provides more granular control over dimensional settings.

```css:scale.css showLineNumbers
--scale-width-<size>
--scale-height-<size>
--scale-padding-<size>
--scale-gap-<size>
--scale-radius-<size>
--scale-icon-size-<size>
--scale-text-size-<size>
--scale-text-height-<size>
```
